title: Microsoft is disabling SMB1 in Windows 11 Home, and it will be removed in the future
content:
Microsoft has announced that it’s no longer shipping the SMB1 (Server Message Block version 1) protocol by default with Windows 11 Home starting with the next major release for Windows 11. This is the next major step in getting rid of the long-deprecated protocol, which some users have still been holding onto. Additionally, in the

The post Microsoft is disabling SMB1 in Windows 11 Home, and it will be removed in the future appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Microsoft has announced that it's going to be disabling SMB1 support by default in Windows 11 Home in the next major release.
